section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The navigation system can determine the precise position of the vehicle with the aid of satellites, and guide you to every destination entered.
Certain functions of the navigation system are limited until they have been selected for data transfer. These services can be individually configured.
With a few exceptions, no entries are possible while driving.

overview.overview-text: Observe when operating systems and devices

warning.paragraph: Operating the integrated information systems and communication devices while driving can distract from surrounding traffic. It is possible to lose control of the vehicle. There is a risk of accident. Only use the systems or devices when the traffic situation allows. As warranted, stop and use the systems and devices while the vehicle is stationary.

There can be deviations between the current traffic situation and details of the navigation instructions, for instance changed road layout or road construction. There is a risk of accident. The respectively valid traffic rules take precedence.
With a few function exceptions, the navigation system/VICS system is adjusted such that it cannot be operated while driving.
With a few function exceptions, the navigation system is adjusted such that it cannot be operated while driving.

overview.overview-text: Safety notes for the operation of the navigation system

warning.paragraph: At extraordinarily fast driving speed it is possible that the route search is not possible due to the vehicle position changes that are occurring too fast.
Some functions cannot be used while driving. Do not use these functions until the vehicle has stopped in a save location.
Adjust the volume in the vehicle making sure that traffic noise outside of the vehicle as well as emergency sirens can still be heard clearly. There is a risk of accident.

Facilities such as police, fire department and hospitals may be located at locations other than indicated due to new construction or relocation. In the event of an accident or other emergency, dial 110 or 119 and conduct yourself according to the situation.

This device is a special device that is intended for installation in a manufacturer-owned vehicle. Do not use in another surrounding area. If the position of the vehicle is displayed incorrectly or other faults are detected in the functionality, stop the vehicle in a safe location.
Do not perform repairs on the navigation system yourself. Have repairs performed by the Service Center or a qualified repair shop.
The manufacturer is not liable for accidents, damages, etc., that occurred due to the disregard for these safety notes or due to operation or handling that is prohibited in the Owner's Manual.
The function of this device is optimal at an ambient temperature from -20 ℃ to +60 ℃. Do not use the device outside of this temperature range as this could result in system malfunctions.
Sudden temperature fluctuations can cause the formation of condensation on the inside of the device, which can cause faults.

section.title: Via buttons
section.paragraph: Depending on the vehicle equipment, the buttons on the center console or on the control display allow for fast access to the navigation system.

entry.paragraph: If applicable, the last selected menu of the navigation system will be opened.
Call up the navigation system map.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Navigation data is stored in the vehicle and can be updated with a USB device or an automatic map update.
Current navigation data is available from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop or in the ConnectedDrive Store.
Depending on the data volume, the navigation data update may take several hours. The status of the update can be queried.
The navigation data is updated during the trip to preserve the vehicle battery.

action-step.paragraph: Connect the USB device with the new navigation data at a USB port capable of transferring data.
Follow the instructions on the Control Display.
Remove the USB device after the update.

section.title: Information about the current map version
section.paragraph: The status of the map update is displayed during a navigation data update.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Depending on the vehicle equipment and national-market version, the navigation data for the home region is transmitted online to the vehicle several times a year and automatically installed and updated.
Cellular network reception is a prerequisite for the automatic map update.
